attributes.action: recommend to Her Majesty to grant the title 'Royal Wootton Bassett' in recognition of the solemn respect shown by the people of that town to the returning Service personnel who have lost their lives on operations overseas
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Wootton Bassett is a small Wiltshire town. It is usually the first community in the UK through which pass the corteges carrying the bodies of those Servicemen and women who die on operations overseas after the deceased  are flown back to the UK. The townspeople turn out to pay their respects for each of the fallen - and so they stand for all the people of all the villages, towns and cities of this country who owe a debt to those who have given their lives on operations in Her Majesty's armed forces. By petitioning for the creation of 'Royal Wootton Bassett', we all show our gratitude to the townspeople who stand to pay their tribute on our behalf.

This petition runs until the next Armed Forces Day.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the Queen.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
